properties.areaDesc: Lewis, WV; Ritchie, WV; Taylor, WV; Doddridge, WV; Tyler, WV; Harrison, WV; Gilmer, WV
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 11 at 5:00PM EST until January 11 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Eastern Ritchie County in northwestern West Virginia...
Doddridge County in northern West Virginia...
West central Taylor County in northern West Virginia...
Northern Gilmer County in north central West Virginia...
Lewis County in northern West Virginia...
Tyler County in northern West Virginia...
Harrison County in northern West Virginia...

* Until 545 PM EST.

* At 500 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from near Paden City to 7 miles southeast of Middlebourne
to 8 miles southeast of Harrisville to 6 miles northwest of
Glenville to near Grantsville, moving east at 55 mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to
mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings.

* Locations impacted include...
Clarksburg, Weston, Glenville, Middlebourne, Bridgeport, Shinnston,
Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Lumberport,
West Union, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, Stonewall Jackson, West Milford,
Lost Creek, Jane Lew and Pullman.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 79 between mile markers 90 and 129.
Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 41 and 82.
Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 4.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service
office in Charleston West Virginia.

Please report severe weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the
Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or
by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
